item.title: Battlefield 6 is Already Doing CoD-Like Numbers
item.description:
Battlefield 6 is just five days into its global launch and is already posting Call of Duty -like numbers across gaming platforms. The release of Battlefield 6 has been widely anticipated since the beta, and initial reports of sales and player numbers since October 10 have been larger than prior premium-shooter games released by EA, including Apex Legends .

Statistical comparison between the Battlefield 6 and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 beta weekends showed that Battlefield 6 came out on top on the Steam platform. Concurrent players reached over 520,000 on Battlefield 6 , with Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 peaking around 99,000 concurrent players on Steam. Based on beta weekends alone, Battlefield 6 had the potential of being more popular at launch.

Battlefield 6 Sells Over 7 Million Units in Five Days

Data shared with GamesIndustry.biz has revealed that Battlefield 6 has sold over 7 million copies across all platforms. Alinea Analytics writer Rhys Elliot estimates the initial sales figures give EA around $350 million in gross revenue. Steam accounts for over half of the copies sold at 56.7%, with 23.7% of sales on the PS5, and 19.6% of sales on the Xbox Series consoles. Additionally, the UK Sales Charts put Battlefield 6 at the top for the week ending October 11, surpassing EA Sports FC 26 .

Launch day for Battlefield 6 was already huge for the title. Battlefield 6 made over $100 million on Steam with 1.8 million copies sold on October 10. Steam daily active user numbers have also been high and steady, with 2.3 million to 2.5 million players every day since launch. Twitch has also been running a Drop campaign that has viewership for Battlefield 6 peaked at 865,000 concurrent viewers, which could bring more players to the game to claim their prizes.

While the launch of Battlefield 6 has been a success for EA, it hasn’t come without its challenges. Some gamers had issues trying to play Battlefield 6 with the EA App on launch day, with the launcher telling players that they didn’t own the game yet. EA has since fixed the issue and provided affected players with in-game boosters and a free season pass.

As of the time of writing, these exact figures have not been confirmed by EA. It also has yet to be seen if the launch of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 will significantly affect player numbers when it releases on November 14. Elliot’s data shows that 3% of Battlefield 6 players have Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 on their Steam Wishlist. However, Season 1 of Battlefield 6 launches on October 28, so players will have fresh content to look forward to as EA tries to retain their player base before Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 releases.

16
8.6 /10
9 /10

item.title: Best HUD Settings to Reduce Clutter in Battlefield 6
item.description:
Battlefield 6 has a lot going on in its HUD, and with markers appearing above both allies and enemies, it's easy to lose immersion. However, while the HUD can be turned off completely, parts of it are necessary for gameplay. Thankfully, individual components of the HUD can be turned off or tinkered with to find a compromise between immersion and reducing HUD clutter in BF6 ​​​.

Why Turning The HUD Off Completely Is Problematic in Battlefield 6

Battlefield 6 looks absolutely stunning with the HUD turned off , and it is perfectly possible to play this way casually. However, in both multiplayer and the campaign, there are problems with having no HUD , especially as there is no way to quickly display it.

Campaign Issues With The HUD Off

Parts of the campaign are fully playable with the HUD off , especially when following a squad leader and when using normal weapons. However, there are times when players are supposed to press a certain button or stand in a specific spot to advance the mission , but without the HUD on, the player is clueless.

A great example is in the first mission, when the squad stops before going up the stairs. For those who get stuck here without the HUD on, it turns out they must click the interact button to tap a squad member on the shoulder , telling them to proceed.

When controlling vehicles and drones , players may also be a bit lost without the HUD. For these missions, it's best to turn the HUD back on.

Multiplayer Issues With The HUD Off

Multiplayer can also be played with the HUD off, but at times, players will be a liability to their team, and they are at a competitive disadvantage . These issues include:

  • Not knowing where the objectives are.
  • Not taking advantage of spotted enemies.
  • Confusion over allies and enemies.
  • Controlling tanks and flying planes.

Best HUD Settings To Reduce Clutter In Battlefield 6

The following settings that have been listed are only the ones that have been altered to create a more immersive HUD in Battlefield 6 . If a setting hasn't been changed and remains at its default value, it hasn't been listed.

Sadly, some HUD elements can only be disabled by completely turning the HUD off at the cost of desired interface elements.

Accessibility

  • Subtitles: Off
  • Peak Hint: Off
  • Ping Hints: Off
  • Color Profiles: Play around with custom colors for enemies, friendlies, & squad.

After changing these Accessibility settings, the rest is found under Graphics , and then scroll down to Interface & HUD .

Interface & HUD

  • Infantry HUD Motion: Off
  • Vehicle HUD Motion: Off
  • Show Soldier Overlays: Off
  • Show Vehicle Overlays: Off
  • Show Outlines on Targeted Friendly Soldiers: Off

Advanced HUD Settings

  • Show Kills Made By: None
  • Kill Feed Icons: Off
  • Ping Notifications: Off
  • Minimap Background Opacity: 0
  • Show Loot: Off
  • Simplified Squad List: On
  • Show Compass Multiplayer: Off
  • Compass Opacity: 0
  • Show HUD Prompts: Off

Unfortunately, the minimap cannot be hidden, even though it could be in the beta.

HUD Icons

  • Ping Hints: Off
  • Objective Icons: All 50
  • Friendly Icons Opacity: 0
  • Friendly Icons Opacity (Zoomed): 0
  • Friendly Revive Icons Opacity: 0
  • Friendly Revive Icons Opacity (Zoomed): 0
  • Squad Icons Opacity: 0
  • Squad Icons Opacity (Zoomed): 0
  • Squad Revive Icons Opacity: 0
  • Squad Revive Icons Opacity (Zoomed): 0
  • Enemy Icons Scale: 80
  • Enemy Icons Opacity: 70
  • Enemy Icons Opacity (Zoomed): 70
  • Neutral Icons Opacity: 0
  • Neutral Icons Opacity (Zoomed): 0
  • Ping Marker Icons Opacity: 0
  • Ping Marker Icons Opacity (Zoomed): 0

The most important thing is making the friendly and squad icons invisible. Thus, only enemies will be shown.

Crosshairs & Indicators

  • Crosshair Opacity: 0
  • Hit Indicator Opacity: 0
  • Hit Indicator Number Enabled: Off

Chat

  • Chat Visibility: Hide
16
8.6 /10
9 /10

item.title: What You Should Know Before Buying Pokémon Legends: Z-A
item.description: Pokémon Legends: Z-A drops on October 16th, and with it comes a whole new Pokémon adventure. Old mechanics like Mega Evolution have returned, but new mechanics like a real-time battle are here too. So today, let's go over everything you need to know before embarking on this new journey.

item.title: Best FPS Games With NO Guns
item.description:
The first-person shooter genre has always been synonymous with bullets, explosions, and military chaos, but not every FPS needs a gun to be fun. Some of the most creative and memorable first-person experiences have ditched traditional firearms entirely, focusing instead on melee combat, magic, and movement-based mechanics that challenge the conventions of what an FPS can be.

Across a range of settings, times, and styles, there are quite a few great games out there that prove that guns aren't integral to the FPS experience. From prehistoric adventures that send players back to the Stone Age to pixelated fortresses full of magic and demons, for players looking for something a bit different, the gaming world has plenty of titles to scratch that itch.

Far Cry Primal

Going Back To A Simpler Time

Far Cry Primal
8 /10
7.7 /10
Released
February 23, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Far Cry Primal takes the open-world chaos of Ubisoft’s shooter series and drops it 12,000 years into the past. Gone are the assault rifles and grenades, and in their place are spears, bows, and primitive clubs. Players take on the role of Takkar, a hunter struggling to unite tribes and survive in a brutal world dominated by mammoths, sabertooths, and rival clans.

Combat is visceral and personal, demanding precision, timing, and resourcefulness instead of modern weaponry. With its hunting mechanics, survival elements, and dynamic wildlife, the game demonstrates that even with some sticks and stones, the first-person combat can be just as satisfying.

Ghostrunner 2

Speed Is Everything

Ghostrunner 2
8.0 /10
Released
October 26, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Intense Violence
Developer(s)
One More Level
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Ghostrunner 2 is a lightning-fast blend of parkour and melee combat set in a neon-drenched cyberpunk world. Players embody a cybernetic assassin armed only with a katana, slicing through enemies in one-hit kills while dodging bullets with acrobatic speed.

Rather than relying on firepower, the game rewards mastery of momentum, precision, and timing. Every encounter becomes a puzzle of movement and reaction, where agility replaces ammunition, and the combination of first-person platforming and razor-sharp combat makes the game feel like a non-stop adrenaline ride that players will never want to end.

Ghostwire: Tokyo

Blending Horror With Intense Action

Ghostwire: Tokyo
7.0 /10
Released
March 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Tango Gameworks
Platform(s)
PS5, PC, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

In Ghostwire: Tokyo , firearms are replaced by the mystical art of Ethereal Weaving, allowing players to wield elemental forces through intricate hand gestures. Set in a haunted version of Tokyo where spirits roam the empty streets, combat feels like a choreographed dance of magic and movement, with every frame looking like a scene from a blockbuster movie.

Each elemental attack, whether wind, fire, or water, serves a distinct purpose, encouraging fluid, tactical play from start to finish. Combined with its atmospheric storytelling and eerie world design, Ghostwire proves that FPS combat can be just as thrilling when powered by the supernatural instead of gunpowder.

Immortals of Aveum

Stylish Spells And Abilities Galore

Immortals of Aveum
7 /10
7.0 /10
Released
August 22, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Ascendant Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Immortals of Aveum replaces bullets with magic, turning the first-person shooter idea into a spellcasting spectacle. Players take on the role of Jak, a battlemage fighting in a sprawling magical war where glowing sigils and elemental projectiles become the player's main weapon against the dark forces that threaten the world.

The combat system is built on fast-paced, color-coded magic types, each acting like a different kind of gun, yet maintaining the identity of traditional sorcery. The result is a dazzling blend of action and visual flair that delivers the excitement of an FPS through the power of arcane energy.

Wizordum

Trading Rifles For Staffs

Wizordum
FPS
Systems
Released
November 29, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Emberheart Games
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Wizordum is a love letter to classic ‘90s shooters like Doom and Heretic, but instead of guns, it arms players with wands, staves, and elemental spells. Every level is a maze of secrets, monsters, and fast-paced combat, wrapped in nostalgic pixel art and thundering sound design.

It captures the essence of old-school FPS gameplay while replacing military grit with magical chaos. Whether blasting skeletons with fireballs or summoning protective shields, the game manages to prove that classic shooter design can thrive without a single firearm in sight.

Heretic + Hexen

The Original Fantasy Boomer Shooters

Heretic + Hexen
FPS
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
August 7, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
id Software, NightDive Studios
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Long before modern graphics, Heretic and Hexen pioneered the concept of a magic-based first-person shooter. Now with a long-awaited revival, these games trade guns for wands, tomes, and otherworldly relics, immersing players in gothic realms filled with monsters and mystery that truly transport players to a different time.

The spell-based combat and dark fantasy atmosphere feel distinctive in such a saturated genre, capturing players with their satisfying mechanics and unique visuals. And despite appearing dated compared to other modern titles, the gameplay still feels crisp and punchy, giving players just as much enjoyment as any other shooter out there.

Mage Arena

Hilarious Magical Warfare

Mage Arena
Action
Systems
Released
July 24, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
jrsjams
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Mage Arena distills the chaos of classic arena shooters into a battle of arcane mastery. Players duel across magical battlegrounds using elemental projectiles, teleportation, and defensive wards, all using nothing but their voices, which creates a hilarious blend of laughter and panic for players on all sides.

Half the battle is getting the hang of throwing the spells, as one slight mispronunciation could lead to the player losing their lives. The simplistic design and warm community feel make the game so inviting yet deeply compelling for both hardcore FPS fans and multiplayer lovers alike.

item.title: More Halo Remake Details Leak Online
item.description:
Additional details about the gameplay of Halo: Combat Evolved 's rumored remake have emerged, stating that it will feature some updated ways for players to move and fight in the field of battle. There's still no official confirmation that a remake of Halo: Combat Evolved is happening at Microsoft, but a reputable leaker seems confident in its existence and about changes from the original game.

Rumors about a remake of the first Halo game started popping up in early 2024, with projections that it would be released sometime in 2026. The news has been exciting to many of the Microsoft faithful, as the game's original 2001 release marked the first major hit for the Xbox brand and has spawned a franchise that includes six mainline games, several spin-offs, and even a two-season-long live-action streaming television series on Paramount+.

Halo Remake Reportedly Updates Gameplay

A new report from Halo Leaks account on Twitter states that the game is being built using "modern gameplay mechanics." It doesn't go into too much detail on how these mechanics will differ from the original game's controls and features, but one change it tells fans to expect is the addition of sprinting. This gameplay mechanic wasn't available in the original releases of the first three mainline Halo games, and it made its franchise debut as one of the new features in Halo Reach , which was released in 2010. Similar gameplay mechanics to the ones being used in the remake are also reportedly being developed for an upcoming Halo multiplayer game which has been floating around the rumor mill under the title Project Ekur, but which Halo Leaks believes is also the multiplayer element for Halo 7 .

The existence of a separate multiplayer Halo game is also a rumor that has been shared by multiple sources. In July, Rebs Gaming reported that multiplayer mode could be a missing feature in the Halo: Combat Evolved remake, after he reportedly spoke with two different sources connected to the development of Halo games, both of whom denied knowing anything about a multiplayer element. Rebs Gaming also hinted at the possibility of a sprint feature being added to the game in early October.

While fans have had to rely solely on leaks and rumors for news about the potential upcoming Halo projects, that could change soon. The Halo World Championships are set for October 24, and developers behind the franchise have stated that they will be revealing some of the projects they have been working on during that competition. There's no guarantee that the remake or the multiplayer project will be up for discussion, but since both rumored games are hot topics in the Halo community, it's likely they will at least be addressed.

9.4 /10

Halo: Combat Evolved
